com.arkoisystems.arkoicompiler.stage.syntaxAnalyzer

Class SyntaxAnalyzer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.arkoisystems.arkoicompiler.stage.AbstractStage
      • com.arkoisystems.arkoicompiler.stage.syntaxAnalyzer.SyntaxAnalyzer

  • public class SyntaxAnalyzer
extends AbstractStage
    This class is an implementation of the AbstractStage. It will parse an AST (Abstract Syntax Tree) with help of the parsed AbstractToken list of the LexicalAnalyzer.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private ArkoiClass arkoiClass
      This defines the ArkoiClass in which the SyntaxAnalyzer got created.
      private SyntaxErrorHandler errorHandler
      The SyntaxErrorHandler is used for error which are happening through the process of parsing the AbstractSyntaxAST's.
      private int position
      The current token position of the SyntaxAnalyzer.
      private RootSyntaxAST rootSyntaxAST
      The RootSyntaxAST which is getting parsed directly at the beginning.
      private AbstractToken[] tokens
      The AbstractToken[] which is used to get current, peeked, next tokens without needing to use a List or something else.

      SyntaxAnalyzer(@NonNull ArkoiClass arkoiClass)
      Constructs a new SyntaxAnalyzer with the given parameters.

      Checks if the current AbstractToken matches with the given AbstractNumberToken.NumberType.

        private final ArkoiClass arkoiClass
        This defines the ArkoiClass in which the SyntaxAnalyzer got created.

      • errorHandler

        @Expose
private final SyntaxErrorHandler errorHandler
        The SyntaxErrorHandler is used for error which are happening through the process of parsing the AbstractSyntaxAST's.

      • tokens

        private AbstractToken[] tokens
        The AbstractToken[] which is used to get current, peeked, next tokens without needing to use a List or something else.

      • position

        @Expose
private int position
        The current token position of the SyntaxAnalyzer. Used for methods like currentToken() or peekToken(int).

      • rootSyntaxAST

        @Expose
private RootSyntaxAST rootSyntaxAST
        The RootSyntaxAST which is getting parsed directly at the beginning.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SyntaxAnalyzer

        public SyntaxAnalyzer(@NonNull
                      @NonNull ArkoiClass arkoiClass)
        Constructs a new SyntaxAnalyzer with the given parameters. It will set the ArkoiClass it got created in and also the SyntaxErrorHandler and RootSyntaxAST are getting created.
        Parameters:
        arkoiClass - the ArkoiClass in which the SyntaxAnalyzer got created.

    • Method Detail

      • processStage

        public boolean processStage()
        Overwritten method from the AbstractStage class which will run this stage. It will reset the current position and the tokens array. Also it will return the RootSyntaxAST if the parsing went well or null if an error occurred.
        Specified by:
        processStage in class AbstractStage
        Returns:
        the RootSyntaxAST if everything went well or null if an error occurred.

      • errorHandler

        public SyntaxErrorHandler errorHandler()
        Overwritten method from the AbstractStage class which will return the created SyntaxErrorHandler.
        Specified by:
        errorHandler in class AbstractStage
        Returns:
        the SyntaxErrorHandler which got created in the constructor.

      • matchesCurrentToken

        public AbstractNumberToken matchesCurrentToken(@NonNull
                                               AbstractNumberToken.NumberType numberType)
        Checks if the current AbstractToken matches with the given AbstractNumberToken.NumberType. First of all it will check if the AbstractToken even is an instance of AbstractNumberToken. If not it will return null or the AbstractNumberToken which got checked for the AbstractNumberToken.NumberType.
        Parameters:
        numberType - the AbstractNumberToken.NumberType which should get used to compare with the current AbstractToken if it's an instance of AbstractNumberToken.
        Returns:
        null if the current AbstractToken is not an AbstractNumberToken or the AbstractNumberToken.NumberType doesn't match.

      • matchesNextToken

        public AbstractNumberToken matchesNextToken(@NonNull
                                            AbstractNumberToken.NumberType numberType)
        Checks if the next AbstractToken matches with the given AbstractNumberToken.NumberType. First of all it will check if the AbstractToken even is an instance of AbstractNumberToken. If not it will return null or the AbstractNumberToken which got checked for the AbstractNumberToken.NumberType.
        Parameters:
        numberType - the AbstractNumberToken.NumberType which should get used to compare with the next AbstractToken if it's an instance of AbstractNumberToken.
        Returns:
        null if the next AbstractToken is not an AbstractNumberToken or the AbstractNumberToken.NumberType doesn't match.

      • matchesCurrentToken

        public SymbolToken matchesCurrentToken(@NonNull
                                       SymbolToken.SymbolType symbolType)
        Checks if the current AbstractToken matches with the given SymbolToken.SymbolType. First of all it will check if the AbstractToken even is an instance of SymbolToken. If not it will return null or the SymbolToken which got checked for the SymbolToken.SymbolType.
        Parameters:
        symbolType - the SymbolToken.SymbolType which should get used to compare with the current AbstractToken if it's an instance of SymbolToken.
        Returns:
        null if the current AbstractToken is not an SymbolToken or the SymbolToken.SymbolType doesn't match.

      • matchesNextToken

        public SymbolToken matchesNextToken(@NonNull
                                    SymbolToken.SymbolType symbolType)
        Checks if the next AbstractToken matches with the given SymbolToken.SymbolType. First of all it will check if the AbstractToken even is an instance of SymbolToken. If not it will return null or the SymbolToken which got checked for the SymbolToken.SymbolType.
        Parameters:
        symbolType - the SymbolToken.SymbolType which should get used to compare with the next AbstractToken if it's an instance of SymbolToken.
        Returns:
        null if the next AbstractToken is not an SymbolToken or the SymbolToken.SymbolType doesn't match.

      • matchesPeekToken

        public SymbolToken matchesPeekToken(int offset,
                                    @NonNull
                                    SymbolToken.SymbolType symbolType)
        Check if the peeked AbstractToken matches with the given SymbolToken.SymbolType. At first it will check if the offset parameter equal to 0 because it will then just return the result of matchesCurrentToken(SymbolToken.SymbolType). If not it will check if the peeked AbstractToken is an instance of SymbolToken and depending of that it will check for the match of the SymbolToken.SymbolType or simply just return null.
        Parameters:
        offset - the offset which should get added to the current position.
        symbolType - the SymbolToken.SymbolType which should get used to compare the peeked AbstractToken.
        Returns:
        null if the peeked AbstractToken isn't an instance of SymbolToken or it doesn't match the given SymbolToken.SymbolType. If it does it will just return the peeked AbstractToken.

      • matchesCurrentToken

        public AbstractToken matchesCurrentToken(@NonNull
                                         @NonNull TokenType tokenType)
        Checks if the current AbstractToken matches with the given TokenType. If not it will return null or the AbstractNumberToken which got checked for the TokenType.
        Parameters:
        tokenType - the TokenType which should get used to compare with the current AbstractToken.
        Returns:
        null if the current AbstractToken doesn't match the given TokenType. If it does it will just return the peeked AbstractToken.

      • matchesNextToken

        public AbstractToken matchesNextToken(@NonNull
                                      @NonNull TokenType tokenType)
        Checks if the next AbstractToken matches with the given TokenType. If not it will return null or the SymbolToken which got checked for the SymbolToken.SymbolType.
        Parameters:
        tokenType - the TokenType which should get used to compare with the next AbstractToken.
        Returns:
        null if the next AbstractToken doesn't match the given TokenType. If it does it will just return the peeked AbstractToken.

      • matchesPeekToken

        public AbstractToken matchesPeekToken(int offset,
                                      @NonNull
                                      @NonNull TokenType tokenType)
        Check if the peeked AbstractToken matches with the given TokenType. At first it will check if the offset parameter equal to 0 because it will then just return the result of matchesCurrentToken(TokenType). If not it will check if the TokenType matches and depending of that it will return null or the AbstractToken.
        Parameters:
        offset - the offset which should get added to the current position.
        tokenType - the TokenType which should get used to compare the peeked AbstractToken.
        Returns:
        null if the peeked AbstractToken doesn't match the given TokenType. If it does it will just return the peeked AbstractToken.

      • peekToken

        public AbstractToken peekToken(int offset)
        Returns the peeked AbstractToken with the offset declared as a parameter offset. If the offset goes out of bounds, it will just return the last AbstractToken of the array.
        Parameters:
        offset - the offset which should get added to the current position.
        Returns:
        an AbstractToken which is used in the later process.

      • currentToken

        public AbstractToken currentToken()
        Returns the current AbstractToken and returns the last AbstractToken of the array if it went out of bounds.
        Returns:
        an AbstractToken which is used in the later process.

      • nextToken

        public AbstractToken nextToken(int offset)
        Returns the next AbstractToken with an offset. It will return the last AbstractToken in the array if it went out of bounds.
        Parameters:
        offset - the offset which should get added to the current position.
        Returns:
        an AbstractToken which is used in the later process.

      • nextToken

        public AbstractToken nextToken()
        Returns the next AbstractToken without any offset. It will return the last AbstractToken in the array if it went out of bounds.
        Returns:
        an AbstractToken which is used in the later process.
